page.title: 12DRAYFORD
page.content: Drayford is a hamlet half a mile from Worlington.The Little Dart river runs through Drayford and is crossed by a road bridge.There are 10 homes including 2 modern bungalows and a modern house.The rest are cottages.Two of these have been converted from a barn and one has been rebuilt in the style of an old cottage with a thatched roof. Mrs. Hudson, an artist, lives in one of these cottages. Drayford garage,which sells petrol and repairs cars, was burnt down this year and is now being rebuilt. Opposite the garage is Drayford Mill, an old flour mill. The water wheel has been found and the mill is being converted into a pottery by Keiko,a Japanese potter.She exhibits her pots and sells them in London and abroad including Norway and Germany.Altogether 15 children live in Drayford.
